DOC.brief_summary: This study Randomized Controlled Trial ( RCT ) Integrated Cognitive Behavioral Therapy HIV Prevention Pretoria , South Africa . The RCT evaluate efficacy brief motivational interview ( BMI ) cognitive-behavioral couple ' ( IFCBT ) intervention alone combination comparison condition reduce new case HIV sexually transmit infection increase condom use decrease sexual risk behavior , drug use , intimate partner violence among young female drug user Pretoria , South Africa primary intimate partner . In RCT , 384 couple comprise young female drug user ( N = 192 ) ( N = 192 ) trade sex primary intimate heterosexual partner randomly assign one-of-four condition : ( 1 ) test counseling ; ( 2 ) brief motivational interview ( BMI ) ; ( 3 ) cognitive-behavioral couple ' intervention ( IFCBT ) ; ( 4 ) BMI IFCBT combine . Eligibility criterion couple include HIV-negative drug use female age 18 40 primary intimate partner spouse also HIV negative . Each partner couple administer assessment rapid test HIV urine test Chlamydia , gonorrhea , trichomoniasis , drug use baseline 3-month , 6-month , 12-month follow-up .
